A NAAC (National Assessment and Accreditation Council) peer team led by H. P. Khincha, former Vice-Chancellor of Visvesvaraya Technological University, Belgaum, will assess Kongu Engineering College, Perundurai, for accreditation, for three days from February 4 onwards.

Other members of the team constitute Member Coordinator V.K. Mahna, and J. B. Naik, Professor, Department of Chemical Technology, North Maharashtra University, Jalgaon.

The team will assess KEC’s status with regard to various aspects such as curriculum, teaching –learning process, research and consultancy, infrastructure and learning resources, student support facilities, governance, and innovations and best practices, College Principal S. Kuppuswami said.

Programme

EBET Group of Institutions, Kangayam, has announced a two-day faculty programme on research methods on February 5 and 6.

The programme

to be addressed by P. Murugan, National Institute of Technology - Tiruchi, could be

attended free of cost by scholars pursuing M.Phil / Ph.D.

For registration,

contact R. Sivakumar, Professor, over phone 98426 22225 or email: rs.fom@ebet.edu.in

House burgled

Burglars broke into the house of a teacher at Suramangalam near here on Monday and decamped with 28 sovereigns of gold jewellery.

The police said that Palanisamy (52), a Government school teacher, was residing at Housing Board in Kandampatti.

His wife, Vasanthakumari, works as an assistant headmaster in a government school. On Sunday, the couple went to their relative’s house in Coimbatore and returned on Monday evening.

They found the front door lock broken and valuables in the almirah missing. Based on a

complaint, the Suramangalam police registered a case and are investigating.
title: NAAC team to visit KEC
